title: KPL Top 8 Cup
text:
The KPL Top 8 Cup (also known as the KPL Top 8 Knockout, the KPL Top 8 Knockout Cup or simply the Top 8 Knockout, the Top 8 Cup or the Kenyan Top 8 Cup) is a Kenyan <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> championship contested by the top eight teams of the preceding <a href="Kenyan%20Premier%20League">Kenyan Premier League</a> (KPL) season. The inaugural edition of the tournament took place in <a href="2011%20KPL%20Top%208%20Cup">2011</a>, with <a href="Ulinzi%20Stars">Ulinzi Stars</a> as the winners.
Format.
The tournament is played in both a <a href="Single-elimination%20tournament">single-elimination</a> and <a href="Double-elimination%20tournament">double-elimination</a> format. It begins with the quarter-finals, where teams play against each other once. In the semi-finals, teams play each other in <a href="Two-legged%20tie">two matches</a> and the team with more goals <a href="Aggregate%20score">on aggregate</a> advances to the final, which is played once. No <a href="third%20place%20playoff">third place playoff</a> is played.
The winners of the tournament receive a total sum of <a href="Kenya%20shilling">Ksh.</a> 1,000,000 as prize money, although appeals to the <a href="Football%20Kenya%20Federation">Football Kenya Federation</a> have been made to increase the sum as gate collections in the tournament surpass the prize money amount.
